docs.text: " last night " could have an " aka " tagged on the end of it that says , " it's the end of the world , and we feel fine " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " last night " is about just that .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the last night of planet earth's existence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the world is going to end at precisely midnight , january 1st , 2000 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: how scientists were so accurately able to predict when this catastrophic event would occur is never explained .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nor is the event itself .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: throughout the entire movie , no explanation is given as to why this is happening .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in doing this , mckellar ( who also wrote and directed the film ) seems to be trying to transcend the genre .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's attempted to make a film about people , and how each of them deals with their last night of life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film contains no science fiction elements , which allows the viewer to concentrate on the feelings and actions of the characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: mckellar is largely successful in his attempt to rise above his material .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is set in toronto , and follows several people in their various escapades on the last night of existence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's mckellar , who plays a man who just wants to be alone when the moment occurs , but keeps getting interrupted by a woman ( sandra oh ) in search of her husband .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: her husband , played by david cronenberg , is spending the day working at the gas company , informing people that they will attempt to keep providing gas right up until the end .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: finally , there's mckellar's friend , played by callum keith rennie , a man who has spent his final months trying out every sexual perversion you can think of .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: mckellar has crafted a gang of the some of the most interesting characters i've seen in a film in months .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: these people all felt real to me , especially the character played by sandra oh .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we can see her desperation , her utter need to be with her husband in the final hours .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rennie is good , too , as the man who wants to literally try everything before he dies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he exudes such charm and likeablity , it's not surprising that we're rooting for him to get what he wants .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but for me , the biggest surprise in the movie is mckellar .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i knew that he was a talented director , but i had no idea he could act as well .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his insistence to be alone , much to the dismay of his parents , is something that most people would find difficult to understand , but as played by mckellar , we can understand his reasons .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he doesn't buy into the whole notion that just because everyone's going to die , he should immediately find some companionship .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he realizes the relationship would be forced , and they would only be together for the sake of being together .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: mckellar gives a brilliant performance , and i hope he alternates between directing and acting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my only quibble with the film is that we never find out why the world is ending .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i really wanted to know , and my need to know was hanging over the film at all times .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i appreciate the fact that mckellar didn't want the material to rule the film , and that he wanted the movie to be more of a study in human behavious .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , in not telling the audience what the cause of earth's destruction is , he's left a big question that is in their minds throughout the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: another problem is we never see anybody panicking .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i would imagine if the world was ending , and there was nothing to be done about it , a large segment of the population would be going out of their minds .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: instead , we are treated to shots of a giant crowd partying like it's new year's eve .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i just didn't buy the fact that everyone had completely accepted their fate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: no one had the urge to " rage against the dying of the light " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: despite these small problems , " last night " is one of the best movies of the year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as opposed to the moronic " armageddon " , " last night " treats the subject at hand with maturity and believabilty .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and bruce willis never shows up to save the day .
docs.label: positive
